snippet: Some Democrats joined Republicans in approving legislation to ease banking regulations under the 2010 law.
abstract: House of Representatives passes bill, 271 to 154, that will lighten banking regulations contained within 2010 Dodd-Frank financial legislation; Pres Obama has issued veto threat regarding legislation, and congressional Democrats led by Sen Elizabeth Warren have declared they will oppose any erosion of 2010 law; 29 Democrats, however, did join Republicans in the vote.
lead_paragraph: Some Democrats joined Republicans in approving legislation to ease banking regulations under the 2010 law.

headline.main: House Passes Legislation to Ease Some Dodd-Frank Financial Rules
headline.print_headline: House Passes Legislation to Ease Some Dodd-Frank Financial Rules

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
